title: Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary
short_description: Gujarat's largest wetland bird sanctuary, attracting massive flocks of flamingos and pelicans.
long_description: Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary, consisting primarily of a 120.82-square-kilometre lake and ambient marshes, is situated about 64 km to the west of Ahmedabad near Sanand Village, in the Gujarat state of India. Mainly inhabited by migratory birds in winter and spring, it is the largest wetland bird sanctuary in Gujarat, and one of the largest in India. It was declared a Ramsar site in 2012. The lake water is very shallow (4-8 ft), nurturing vast reed beds and aquatic plants, which serve as excellent food and shelter for birds. The sanctuary is famous for the congregation of flamingos that turn the lake pink.
wildlife_significance: Ramsar Site. Supports over 250 species of wetland birds.
major_experiences: Picnic on Dhabla island (with local food)
guides_and_tips: Boatmen act as guides. Negotiate rates if hiring private. Early morning is the only time to see birds up close.
how_to_reach: By Air/Rail: Ahmedabad (64 km). By Road: 1.5 hours drive from Ahmedabad.
permits_and_fees: Entry fee at gate. Boat charges separate and regulated.
conservation_notes: Siltation and water pollution are concerns being addressed.
sample_itinerary: Dawn Trip: Depart Ahmedabad at 4:30 AM. Reach by 6:00 AM. Boat ride for 3 hours. Breakfast on island. Return to Ahmedabad by noon.
safety_tips: Water is shallow but muddy; do not step out of boat. Winters are cold on the water.

operating_season.season_notes: Water levels vital for boat operation.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Boatmen may demand tips/extra for longer rides.
